member.name: M:Tesseract.PixArray.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns a that iterates the the array of .
member.remarks: When done with the enumerator you must call to release any unmanaged resources. However if your using the enumerator in a foreach loop, this is done for you automatically by .Net. This also means that any returned from the enumerator cannot safely be used outside a foreach loop (or after Dispose has been called on the enumerator). If you do indeed need the pix after the enumerator has been disposed of you must clone it using .
member.returns: A that iterates the the array of .

member.name: M:Tesseract.TesseractEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Tesseract.EngineMode)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

remarks.para: The parameter should point to the directory that contains the 'tessdata' folder for example if your tesseract language data is installed in C:\Tesseract\tessdata the value of datapath should be C:\Tesseract. Note that tesseract will use the value of the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable if defined, effectively ignoring the value of parameter.

member.param: The path to the parent directory that contains the 'tessdata' directory, ignored if the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable is defined.
The language to load, for example 'eng' for English.
The value to use when initialising the tesseract engine.

member.name: T:Tesseract.Orientation
member.summary: Represents orientation that the page would need to be rotated so that .
member.remarks:
Orientation is defined as to what side of the page would need to correspond to the 'up' direction such that the characters will be read able. Another way of looking at this what direction you need to rotate you head so that "up" aligns with Orientation, then the characters will appear "right side up" and readable.
In short:
PageUp - Page is correctly alligned with up and no rotation is needed.
PageRight - Page needs to be rotated so the right hand side is up, 90 degress counter clockwise, to be readable.
PageDown - Page needs to be rotated so the bottom side is up, 180 degress counter clockwise, to be readable.
PageLeft - Page needs to be rotated so the left hand side is up, 90 degress clockwise, to be readable.

member.name: F:Tesseract.Orientation.PageUp
member.summary: Page is correctly alligned with up and no rotation is needed.

member.name: F:Tesseract.Orientation.PageRight
member.summary: Page needs to be rotated so the right hand side is up, 90 degress counter clockwise, to be readable.

member.name: F:Tesseract.Orientation.PageDown
member.summary: Page needs to be rotated so the bottom side is up, 180 degress counter clockwise, to be readable.

member.name: F:Tesseract.Orientation.PageLeft
member.summary: Page needs to be rotated so the left hand side is up, 90 degress clockwise, to be readable.

member.name: P:Tesseract.Page.RegionOfInterest
member.summary: The current region of interest being parsed.

member.name: T:Tesseract.PageIterator
member.summary: Represents an object that can iterate over tesseract's page structure.
member.remarks: The iterator points to tesseract's internal page structure and is only valid while the Engine instance that created it exists and has not been subjected to a call to Recognize since the iterator was created.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.Begin
member.summary: Moves the iterator to the start of the page.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.Next(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Moves to the start of the next element at the given level.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.Next(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel,Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Moves the iterator to the next iff the iterator is not currently pointing to the last in the specified (i.e. the last word in the paragraph).
member.param: The iterator level.
The page level.
member.returns: True iff there is another to advance too and the current element is not the last element at the given level; otherwise returns False.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.IsAtBeginningOf(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Returns True if the iterator is at the first element at the given level.
member.remarks: A possible use is to determin if a call to next(word) moved to the start of a new paragraph.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.IsAtFinalOf(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel,Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel)
member.summary: Returns True if the iterator is possitioned at the last element at the given level.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.TryGetBoundingBox(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel,Tesseract.Rect@)
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle of the current element at the given level.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.TryGetBaseline(Tesseract.PageIteratorLevel,Tesseract.Rect@)
member.summary: Gets the baseline of the current element at the given level.
member.remarks: The baseline is the line that passes through (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). WARNING: with vertical text, baselines may be vertical! Returns false if there is no baseline at the current position.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PageIterator.GetProperties
member.summary: Gets the element orientation information that the iterator currently points too.

member.name: T:Tesseract.ElementProperties
member.summary: Represents properties that describe a text block's orientation.

member.name: P:Tesseract.ElementProperties.Orientation
member.summary: Gets the for corresponding text block.

member.name: P:Tesseract.ElementProperties.TextLineOrder
member.summary: Gets the for corresponding text block.

member.name: P:Tesseract.ElementProperties.WritingDirection
member.summary: Gets the for corresponding text block.

member.name: P:Tesseract.ElementProperties.DeskewAngle
member.summary: Gets the angle the page would need to be rotated to deskew the text block.

member.name: T:Tesseract.PageSegMode
member.summary: Represents the possible page layou analysis modes.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.OsdOnly
member.summary: Orientation and script detection (OSD) only.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.AutoOsd
member.summary: Automatic page sementation with orientantion and script detection (OSD).

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.AutoOnly
member.summary: Automatic page segmentation, but no OSD, or OCR.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.Auto
member.summary: Fully automatic page segmentation, but no OSD.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleColumn
member.summary: Assume a single column of text of variable sizes.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleBlockVertText
member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of vertically aligned text.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleBlock
member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of text.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleLine
member.summary: Treat the image as a single text line.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleWord
member.summary: Treat the image as a single word.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.CircleWord
member.summary: Treat the image as a single word in a circle.

member.remarks: Note that the resulting instance takes ownership of the data structure.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Save(System.String,System.Nullable{Tesseract.ImageFormat})
member.summary: Saves the image to the specified file.
member.param: The path to the file.
The format to use when saving the image, if not specified the file extension is used to guess the format.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Clone
member.summary: Increments this pix's reference count and returns a reference to the same pix data.
member.remarks:
A "clone" is simply a reference to an existing pix. It is implemented this way because image can be large and hence expensive to copy and extra handles need to be made with a simple policy to avoid double frees and memory leaks.
The general usage protocol is:
Whenever you want a new reference to an existing call .
Always call on all references. This decrements the reference count and will destroy the pix when the reference count reaches zero.
member.returns: The pix with it's reference count incremented.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Deskew
member.summary: Determines the scew angle and if confidence is high enough returns the descewed image as the result, otherwise returns clone of original image.
member.remarks: This binarizes if necessary and finds the skew angle. If the angle is large enough and there is sufficient confidence, it returns a deskewed image; otherwise, it returns a clone.
member.returns: Returns deskewed image if confidence was high enough, otherwise returns clone of original pix.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Deskew(Tesseract.Scew@)
member.summary: Determines the scew angle and if confidence is high enough returns the descewed image as the result, otherwise returns clone of original image.
member.remarks: This binarizes if necessary and finds the skew angle. If the angle is large enough and there is sufficient confidence, it returns a deskewed image; otherwise, it returns a clone.
member.param: The scew angle and confidence
member.returns: Returns deskewed image if confidence was high enough, otherwise returns clone of original pix.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Deskew(System.Int32,Tesseract.Scew@)
member.summary: Determines the scew angle and if confidence is high enough returns the descewed image as the result, otherwise returns clone of original image.
member.remarks: This binarizes if necessary and finds the skew angle. If the angle is large enough and there is sufficient confidence, it returns a deskewed image; otherwise, it returns a clone.
member.param: The reduction factor used by the binary search, can be 1, 2, or 4.
The scew angle and confidence
member.returns: Returns deskewed image if confidence was high enough, otherwise returns clone of original pix.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Deskew(Tesseract.ScewSweep,System.Int32,System.Int32,Tesseract.Scew@)
member.summary: Determines the scew angle and if confidence is high enough returns the descewed image as the result, otherwise returns clone of original image.
member.remarks: This binarizes if necessary and finds the skew angle. If the angle is large enough and there is sufficient confidence, it returns a deskewed image; otherwise, it returns a clone.
member.param: linear sweep parameters
The reduction factor used by the binary search, can be 1, 2, or 4.
The threshold value used for binarizing the image.
The scew angle and confidence
member.returns: Returns deskewed image if confidence was high enough, otherwise returns clone of original pix.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.BinarizeOtsuAdaptiveThreshold(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Binarization of the input image based on the passed parameters and the Otsu method
member.param: sizeX Desired tile X dimension; actual size may vary.
sizeY Desired tile Y dimension; actual size may vary.
smoothX Half-width of convolution kernel applied to threshold array: use 0 for no smoothing.
smoothY Half-height of convolution kernel applied to threshold array: use 0 for no smoothing.
scoreFraction Fraction of the max Otsu score; typ. 0.1 (use 0.0 for standard Otsu).
member.returns: ppixd is a pointer to the thresholded PIX image.

Green weight
Blue weight

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Rotate(System.Single,Tesseract.RotationMethod,Tesseract.RotationFill,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a new image by rotating this image about it's centre.
member.remarks:
Please note the following:
Rotation will bring in either white or black pixels, as specified by from the outside as required.
Above 20 degrees, sampling rotation will be used if shear was requested.
Colormaps are removed for rotation by area map and shear.
The resulting image can be expanded so that no image pixels are lost. To invoke expansion, input the original width and height. For repeated rotation, use of the original width and heigh allows expansion to stop at the maximum required size which is a square of side = sqrt(w*w + h*h).
Please note there is an implicit assumption about RGB component ordering.
member.param: The angle to rotate by, in radians; clockwise is positive.
The rotation method to use.
The fill color to use for pixels that are brought in from the outside.
The original width; use 0 to avoid embedding
The original height; use 0 to avoid embedding
member.returns: The image rotated around it's centre.

member.name: T:Tesseract.PixColormap
member.summary: Represents a colormap.
member.remarks: Once the colormap is assigned to a pix it is owned by that pix and will be disposed off automatically when the pix is disposed off.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PixData.EndianByteSwap
member.summary: Swaps the bytes on little-endian platforms within a word; bytes 0 and 3 swapped, and bytes `1 and 2 are swapped.
member.remarks: This is required for little-endians in situations where we convert from a serialized byte order that is in raster order, as one typically has in file formats, to one with MSB-to-the-left in each 32-bit word, or v.v. See

member.name: T:Tesseract.TextLineOrder
member.summary: The text lines are read in the given sequence.

remarks.para: For example in English the order is top-to-bottom. Chinese vertical text lines are read right-to-left. While Mongolian is written in vertical columns like Chinese but read left-to-right.
Note that only some combinations makes sense for example implies .

member.name: F:Tesseract.TextLineOrder.LeftToRight
member.summary: The text lines form vertical columns ordered left to right.

member.name: F:Tesseract.TextLineOrder.RightToLeft
member.summary: The text lines form vertical columns ordered right to left.

member.name: F:Tesseract.TextLineOrder.TopToBottom
member.summary: The text lines form horizontal columns ordered top to bottom.

member.name: T:Tesseract.WritingDirection
member.summary: The grapheme cluster within a line of text are laid out logically in this direction, judged when looking at the text line rotated so that Orientation is "page up".

member.name: F:Tesseract.WritingDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: The text line from the left hand side to the right hand side when the page is rotated so it's orientation is .

member.name: F:Tesseract.WritingDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: The text line from the right hand side to the left hand side when the page is rotated so it's orientation is .

member.name: F:Tesseract.WritingDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: The text line from the top to the bottom of the page when the page is rotated so it's orientation is .
